result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron John Volkman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count 2 and concurrent with any other sentence.  The Court granted huber privilleges for work, chiildcare and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample within 2 weeks of release date.
Court ordered the defendant to pay mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA by the end of supervision. Court waived all nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.  Any bail on deposit shall be applied.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Obtain and maintain employment or enroll in school.

No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No new law violations rising to the level of prbable cause.

Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.  
Cooperate with the Department/agent.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count 1 and concurrent with any other sentence.  The Court granted huber privilgeges for work, childcare and treatment.

miscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may never own or possess a firearm/ammunition.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron John Volkman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aaron John Volkman in court with attorney Michael K. Moran.  Defendant Aaron John Volkman in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  


Sentencing proceeded.
...
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Count 2 and CONCURRENT any other sentence. The Court granted Huber privileges for work, childcare, and treatment.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Count 1 and CONCURRENT any other sentence. The Court granted Huber privileges for work, childcare, and treatment.  

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: 
The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  
- Provide DNA sample within 2 weeks of release date.
- Obtain and maintain employment or enroll in school. 
- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment. 
- Cooperate with the Department/Agent
- No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Court ordered the defendant to pay mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.  Any bail on deposit shall be applied.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm/ammunition.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  
20 day appeal rights given.
Character Letter; Filed and forwarded to Judge for review.
Received and filed; character letters.
Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

OFF THE RECORD- Attorney Michael K. Moran in court, defendant Aaron John Volkman not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Court sets next court date for a Plea/Sentencing date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
22RM014956  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 03/21/2022
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Aaron John Volkman in court with Attorney Michael K. Moran.  Defendant Aaron John Volkman in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Bail hearing.  The bail hearing was held via zoom.  Argument to bail heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS defense motion for bail reduction.  Defense requests Status date. Defense has received discovery and the state's offer requesting a status conference to review the materials with client.  Case remains calendared in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aaron John Volkman in court with Attorney Michael K. Moran.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Dathe. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Received and Filed. Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Aaron John Volkman not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. SPD need more time to appoint counsel on this case. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aaron John Volkman in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Indigency hearing. All parties appeared via zoom. Court is advised that the defendant is being represented by SPD in his other matter. Court orders defendant to be re-interviewed by SPD. Clerk will contact SPD. Case remains calendared as previously set.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Aaron John Volkman in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Aaron John Volkman in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aaron John Volkman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/7e281253-5611-374f-1965-26b586969cf8  Indigency hearing scheduled for January 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
